CO1.exam_question: In a wireless mesh network, what is the most significant disadvantage of flooding as a routing technique? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: It causes high routing overhead due to redundant transmissions
CO1.exam_ch2: It only works for shortrange communication
CO1.exam_ch3: It results in a slow convergence time
CO1.exam_answer: It causes high routing overhead due to redundant transmissions

CO1.exam_question: Which of the following techniques is used for error correction rather than just error detection? (CO1)
Which of the following is NOT a core function of network software?(CO1)
In a wireless communication system, if the frequency is increased, what happens to the signal's range in free space? (CO1)

Let X and Y be the two stations on an Ethernet and both stations have a ready state of frames to send.Both X and Y attempt to transmit a frame after the first collision. What is the probability that neither X nor Y wins? (CO1)
What is the minimum Hamming distance required for single-bit error correction?(CO1)
A sender transmits two 16-bit words: 1011001110010110 and 1100110101011101. If 1's complement checksum is used, what is the transmitted checksum? (CO1)
In a wireless network, what happens when a device moves out of range of its current access point but is within range of another? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: The device loses connection and needs to reconnect manually
CO1.exam_ch2: The device automatically switches to the new access point
CO1.exam_ch4: The device waits for a fixed period before attempting reconnection
CO1.exam_answer: The device automatically switches to the new access point

CO1.exam_question: If you need to configure an Ethernet interface to manually select the speed and duplex settings instead of relying on auto-negotiation, which command would you use? (CO1)
Which transmission mode allows data to be sent in both directions simultaneously? (CO1)
In the OSI model, encryption and decryption of data occur at which layer?(CO1)
Mesh topology can be created using which of the following formula? (CO1)
In a network with a hybrid topology that combines both mesh and star topologies, what is the main benefit of using this hybrid approach? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: It reduces the cost of cable installation
CO1.exam_ch2: It improves the reliability and fault tolerance of the network
CO1.exam_ch3: It simplifies the configuration and management of the network
CO1.exam_answer: It improves the reliability and fault tolerance of the network

CO1.exam_question: A data word is 1011. Using even parity Hamming Code, what will be the transmitted codeword? (CO1)
A 16-bit checksum is calculated for the data 10110011 11001100. What is the checksum? (CO1)
A 1 Gbps link is used to transmit a 10 MB file. The propagation delay is 5 ms. What is the total time taken to transmit the file if the link is fully utilized? (CO1)
A router processes a 500-byte packet over a 1 Gbps link with a propagation delay of 2 ms. What is the total delay? (CO1)
A CRC generator polynomial is x4+x+1. What is the maximum number of bit errors it can detect? (CO1)
In even parity, what is the parity bit for the binary data 1011011?(CO1)

A network communication system uses even parity for error detection in data transmission. A sender is about to send a message consisting of a series of 8-bit data frames. Each data frame will include 7 data bits followed by a parity bit. The parity bit will be set in such a way that the total number of 1s in each frame (including the parity bit) is even. The system transmits 5 frames, and the following is the list of 7 data bits in each frame: 1. Frame 1: 1010101 2. Frame 2: 1101000 3. Frame 3: 0110010 4. Frame 4: 1001101 5. Frame 5: 0101111 Now, consider the following conditions: 1. There is no error during transmission. 2. The parity bit is correctly computed for each frame based on the rule of even parity. You are required to calculate the total number of 1s in all 5 transmitted frames (including the parity bits) after transmission, assuming that no bits are altered. (CO1)
Given the data 101100 and the CRC polynomial x3+x+1 (binary: 1011), what is the remainder after division? (CO1)
A bit-stuffing based framing protocol uses an 8-bit delimiter pattern of HDLC's flag. If the input bit string is 101111110111110, then the output bit string after stuffing is: (CO1)
A Wi-Fi signal operating at 2.4 GHz travels further than one operating at 5 GHz. Why? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: Higher frequencies have shorter wavelengths, leading to higher attenuation
CO1.exam_ch2: Lower frequencies suffer from more interference
CO1.exam_ch3: 5 GHz signals have a higher data rate but lower power
CO1.exam_ch4: 2.4 GHz has more antennas in a router
CO1.exam_answer: Higher frequencies have shorter wavelengths, leading to higher attenuation

CO1.exam_question: A 50 MB file is transmitted over a 100 Mbps link with a propagation delay of 10 ms. How long does it take to completely send the file? (CO1)
If a received codeword has a non-zero syndrome, it means:(CO1)
CO1.exam_ch4: At least one error has occurred
CO1.exam_answer: At least one error has occurred

CO1.exam_question: A network has 100 devices connected in a star topology to a switch with a 1 Gbps maximum throughput. Each device can send data at 100 Mbps. If 20 devices start transmitting at full speed simultaneously, will congestion occur? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: No, the switch can handle the load
CO1.exam_ch2: Yes, the required bandwidth exceeds the switch capacity
CO1.exam_ch3: No, because the devices share bandwidth dynamically
CO1.exam_ch4: Yes, but only if all devices send data to a single receiver
CO1.exam_answer: Yes, the required bandwidth exceeds the switch capacity

CO1.exam_question: A network uses the Hamming code for error correction. If the codeword length is 11 bits, how many data bits and parity bits does it have? (CO1)

In a star topology, the central hub is connected to 20 devices. If the hub operates at 1 Gbps and each device sends 1 Mbps of data at any given time, what is the maximum bandwidth that can be used by all devices simultaneously without causing congestion? (CO1)
Given the following received 8-bit data: 11010101, with a syndrome value of '010', what is the corrected data? (CO1)
Which of the following error detection methods uses parity bits?(CO1)
In the case of a Hamming Code system, if the received data has a syndrome value of '110', what action should be taken? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: No error exists in the data.
CO1.exam_ch2: The error is in the bit at position 6.
CO1.exam_ch3: The error is in the bit at position 4.
CO1.exam_ch4: The error is in the bit at position 3.
CO1.exam_answer: The error is in the bit at position 6.

CO1.exam_question: In CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check), the divisor is generally a:(CO1)

Why is it counterintuitive that fiber-optic cables, which are known for their high bandwidth, can still experience signal degradation over long distances despite being free from electromagnetic interference? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: Fiber-optic signals degrade due to scattering caused by imperfections in the glass
CO1.exam_ch2: Fiber-optic cables experience high latency due to the need for light signal conversion at each hop
CO1.exam_ch3: The light signals in fiber-optic cables experience loss due to diffraction
CO1.exam_ch4: High-speed fiber-optic signals suffer from dispersion, where different light pulses travel at different speeds
CO1.exam_answer: High-speed fiber-optic signals suffer from dispersion, where different light pulses travel at different speeds

CO1.exam_question: What will happen in an Ethernet network if there is a mismatch in the duplex settings between two devices? (CO1)
CO1.exam_ch1: The devices will automatically negotiate the correct settings
CO1.exam_ch3: A halfduplex mode will be established, leading to collisions and retransmissions
CO1.exam_ch4: The devices will stop communicating entirely
CO1.exam_answer: A halfduplex mode will be established, leading to collisions and retransmissions

CO1.exam_question: Which layer of the TCP/IP model is responsible for end-to-end delivery of data and error recovery?(CO1)

In a particular network topology, if a single connection is broken, the entire network becomes inoperable. However, this topology is highly cost-effective for small networks. Which topology is being described?(CO1)

CO2.exam_question: A (7,4) Hamming Code is received as 1110011. The parity bits indicate an error at position 2. What is the correct code? (CO2)
If a 16-bit message 1010101010101010 and 1100110011001100 is transmitted, what should be the checksum? (CO2)
A frame relay network has a committed information rate (CIR) of 212 kbps. Calculate the burst size for 2 seconds. (CO2)

Consider two nodes in a wireless network with a 100 m distance between them. If the received signal strength at the receiver is 50 dBm, what would happen if the distance between the nodes is increased to 200 m? (CO2)
CO2.exam_ch2: The signal strength will decrease by 6 dB
CO2.exam_ch3: The signal strength will remain the same
CO2.exam_ch4: The signal strength will decrease by 12 dB
CO2.exam_answer: The signal strength will decrease by 6 dB

CO2.exam_question: A Go-Back-N ARQ protocol is used with a window size of 4. If the link has a 2 Mbps bandwidth and RTT is 50 ms, calculate the utilization for 2000-bit frames. (CO2)
Which of the following is true regarding the main function of an access control list (ACL) in a router? (CO2)
CO2.exam_ch1: It filters traffic based on MAC addresses
CO2.exam_ch2: It filters traffic based on IP addresses and ports
CO2.exam_ch4: It routes packets to the correct destination
CO2.exam_answer: It filters traffic based on IP addresses and ports

CO2.exam_question: A Shannon's capacity calculation involves a channel bandwidth of 3 kHz and an SNR of 17 dB. Calculate the maximum data rate. (CO2)
What is the checksum for 8-bit datawords 11101110 and 11010101? (CO2)

During congestion avoidance, the TCP congestion window size increases as follows: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, ... after each round-trip time (RTT). If the initial window size is 1 KB, how much data can be sent after 5 RTTs? (CO2)
What is the maximum number of IP addresses that can be assigned in a Class C network? (CO2)
What will be the checksum for data words 11100011 and 10010100? (CO2)

A network transmits a 5 MB file using a 100 Mbps link with a propagation delay of 5 ms. The processing delay at each intermediate router is 2 ms, and the data must traverse 3 routers before reaching the destination. What is the total end-to-end delay? (CO2)
A stop-and-wait protocol transmits a -1200-bit frame over a -1 Mbps link with a -11 ms RTT. What is the efficiency? (CO2)
A company wants to create multiple logical networks within a single switch to segregate broadcast domains. Which networking technology is the best choice?(CO2)
If two 8-bit data segments are 10101100 and 11011010, what is the checksum? (CO2)

An office building has three floors, each requiring 50 devices to be connected to the network. The administrator plans to use subnetting. What is the minimum subnet mask that allows at least 50 devices per subnet? (CO2)
In Go-back 3 flow control protocol every 6th packet is lost. If we have to send 11 packets. How many transmissions will be needed ?(CO2)
Consider a link with a 1000 Mbps bandwidth and a roundtrip time (RTT) of 10 ms. What is the maximum theoretical throughput of the link? (CO2)
A company is assigned a block of IP addresses with a /27 subnet mask. How many usable host addresses are available in each subnet? (CO2)
If the data word 1100101 is transmitted with even parity, what is the parity bit? (CO2)
What is the 7-bit Hamming Code (even parity) for the 4-bit data 1001? (CO2)

One of the major selling points of ATM is its connection-oriented nature, which ensures stable paths for data transmission. However, what is an unexpected problem that this introduces compared to IP networks? (CO2)
CO2.exam_ch1: ATM requires a dedicated path setup before data can flow, increasing initial delay
CO2.exam_ch2: ATM cannot be used for real-time applications like voice and video
CO2.exam_ch3: ATM completely eliminates the need for routing protocols, making networks inefficient
CO2.exam_ch4: ATM is slower than IP in handling large-scale network congestion
CO2.exam_answer: ATM requires a dedicated path setup before data can flow, increasing initial delay

CO2.exam_question: In a (7,4) Hamming Code, a received message is 0110110. If parity checks indicate an error at position 6, what is the correct message? (CO2)
Given an IPv6 address of 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334, which of the following represents the most efficient compressed version of this address? (CO2)
If a message contains 10010010, 01101101, and 11000011, what is the checksum? (CO2)
In a wireless LAN using IEEE 802.11, what is the function of the RTS/CTS (Request to Send / Clear to Send) mechanism?(CO2)
CO2.exam_ch1: To manage multiple access in an ad-hoc network.
CO2.exam_ch2: To prevent hidden terminal problems in a contention-based medium.
CO2.exam_ch3: To increase the transmission speed beyond 54 Mbps.
CO2.exam_ch4: To enforce time-division multiplexing for multiple users.
CO2.exam_answer: To prevent hidden terminal problems in a contention-based medium.

CO2.exam_question: In HDLC, which of the following is true about the "Frame Check Sequence" field? (CO2)
CO2.exam_ch2: It is used for flow control.
CO2.exam_ch3: It is used for error detection.
CO2.exam_answer: It is used for error detection.

CO2.exam_question: Which of the following devices primarily operates at the data link layer but can also function at the network layer when implementing VLANs?(CO2)
For a data word 1001101, what is the even parity bit? (CO2)

Suppose a web server application generates messages consisting of 120 bytes if every second to the Central host, and each message gets encapsulated in a UDP segment and then an IPV4 Datagram. There are no options added in the TCP (or) Ip headers. What percentage of each Datagram will consist of data generated by the application? (CO2)
If a data word 110101 is transmitted with odd parity, what is the parity bit? (CO2)
In an 802.11 WLAN, the RTS/CTS mechanism reduces collisions. If RTS is 22 bytes and CTS is 19 bytes, calculate the overhead percentage for a 500-byte frame. (CO2)
If three 8-bit datawords are 10100011, 11001100, and 10011100, what is the checksum? (CO2)
If two devices communicate over a wireless network and experience signal fading due to weather conditions, how does the Physical Layer handle the situation? (CO2)
CO2.exam_ch1: The Physical Layer amplifies the signal to compensate for fading
CO2.exam_ch2: The Physical Layer ignores the fading and continues to transmit the signal regardless of conditions
CO2.exam_ch3: Signal fading leads to a reduction in signal strength, potentially causing data loss or packet errors
CO2.exam_ch4: The Physical Layer switches to a different transmission frequency to bypass the faded signal
CO2.exam_answer: Signal fading leads to a reduction in signal strength, potentially causing data loss or packet errors

CO2.exam_question: Which of the following is a major drawback of the Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) in backbone networks?(CO2)
CO2.exam_ch1: It does not prevent loops in redundant topologies.
CO2.exam_ch2: It allows only one active path, leading to underutilization of links.
CO2.exam_ch3: It increases latency in packet switching.
CO2.exam_ch4: It does not support link aggregation.
CO2.exam_answer: It allows only one active path, leading to underutilization of links.

CO2.exam_question: The generator polynomial is 1011, and the data word is 1000. What is the CRC remainder? (CO2)

CO3.exam_question: In a mesh network, if one of the routers fails, how does the routing protocol react to ensure uninterrupted data flow? (CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: The failed router is removed from the network, and the next best path is used
CO3.exam_ch2: The network continues without any change
CO3.exam_ch3: The network reroutes the traffic through multiple paths
CO3.exam_ch4: The failed router is automatically repaired
CO3.exam_answer: The failed router is removed from the network, and the next best path is used

CO3.exam_question: Which type of network switch forwards data only after receiving the entire frame and performing error checking? (CO3)
Which of the following techniques is used to prevent the Count to Infinity problem in Distance Vector Routing?(CO3)
Which algorithm is best suited for routing in large networks where the topology can change frequently, such as in adhoc networks? (CO3)
Consider a network with routers running OSPF. If there is a link failure in a router, what will happen to the network's routing tables and convergence time? (CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: The routing tables will remain unchanged, and no convergence will occur
CO3.exam_ch2: The router will immediately remove the failed link from its routing table, causing minimal convergence time
CO3.exam_ch3: The network will undergo complete recalculation, leading to high convergence time
CO3.exam_ch4: The router will use the backup link without updating its routing table
CO3.exam_answer: The router will immediately remove the failed link from its routing table, causing minimal convergence time

CO3.exam_question: In IPv4, which of the following address ranges are reserved for multicast communication? (CO3)
An IPv4 address has a subnet mask of 255.255.255.224. Calculate the number of valid host addresses. (CO3)
Calculate the broadcast address for the subnet 192.168.10.64/26. (CO3)
If a router receives a packet destined for 192.168.1.129/26, which subnet does it belong to? (CO3)

Frames of 1000 bits are sent over a 10^6 bps duplex link between two hosts. The propagation time is 25ms. Frames are to be transmitted into this link to maximally pack them in transit (within the link). What is the minimum number of bits (i) that will be required to represent the sequence numbers distinctly? Assume that no time gap needs to be given between transmission of two frames. (CO3)
A network running Distance Vector Routing experiences the "count-to-infinity" problem. Which of the following mechanisms can help mitigate this issue?(CO3)

A file of 1 MB is transmitted over a circuit-switched network with a dedicated 10 Mbps link, where the setup time is 1 second. In a packet-switched network, the same file is transmitted with a 10 Mbps shared link with no setup time but has a queueing delay of 500 ms. Which method delivers the file faster? (CO3)
Which network topology is best suited for a company that requires high redundancy and fault tolerance? (CO3)
The message 11001001 is to be transmitted using the CRC polynomial x^3 + 1 to protect it from errors. The message that should be transmitted is(CO3)
In an ATM (Asynchronous Transfer Mode) network, which of the following is a reason for using fixed-size cells instead of variable-sized packets?(CO3)
CO3.exam_ch2: To achieve predictable latency and efficient switching.
CO3.exam_ch3: To eliminate the need for traffic shaping.
CO3.exam_ch4: To support higher data rates than fibre optics.
CO3.exam_answer: To achieve predictable latency and efficient switching.

CO3.exam_question: If a router implements NAT (Network Address Translation) with Port Address Translation (PAT), how are the private IP addresses handled? (CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: They are translated to a single public IP address with unique port numbers
CO3.exam_ch2: They are ignored, and no translation occurs
CO3.exam_ch3: They are directly routed without modification
CO3.exam_ch4: They are assigned new private IP addresses within the same range
CO3.exam_answer: They are translated to a single public IP address with unique port numbers

CO3.exam_question: Which transition mechanism allows IPv6 packets to be transmitted over an IPv4-only network by encapsulating them inside IPv4 packets? (CO3)

You are analyzing a network with a large number of devices. Which algorithm would you choose to efficiently manage the address assignment in this network, considering scalability and flexibility? (CO3)

Station A uses 32 byte packets to transmit messages to Station B using a sliding window protocol. The round trip delay between A and B is 80 milliseconds and the bottleneck bandwidth on the path between A and B is 128 kbps. What is the optimal window size that A should use?(CO3)
What is the network address for the IP 172.16.78.205/22?  (CO3)
Why is de-multiplexing an essential feature of the transport layer?(CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: It ensures packets are routed based on IP addresses.
CO3.exam_ch2: It matches incoming data packets to the correct application using port numbers.
CO3.exam_ch3: It encrypts data before forwarding it to the application layer.
CO3.exam_ch4: It is used exclusively in UDP for connectionless communication.
CO3.exam_answer: It matches incoming data packets to the correct application using port numbers.

CO3.exam_question: Suppose the round trip propagation delay for a 10 Mbps Ethernet having 48-bit jamming signal is 46.4 ms. The minimum frame size is (CO3)
A company has been allocated the IP address block 192.168.10.0/24. If they need to create 5 subnets, what is the maximum number of usable hosts per subnet?(CO3)

Each subnet must have 64 addresses (including network and broadcast addresses), which corresponds to /26 (since 26 = 64).A router queue can hold 100 packets. If packets arrive at 500 packets/sec but the router processes only 450 packets/sec, what is the average queue length? (CO3)
In a Go-Back-N sliding window protocol with a window size of N, what happens if the sender transmits all N frames and the first frame is lost?(CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: The receiver buffers all frames and waits for retransmission of the lost frame.
CO3.exam_ch2: The sender must retransmit only the lost frame.
CO3.exam_ch3: The sender must retransmit the lost frame along with all subsequent frames.
CO3.exam_ch4: The receiver acknowledges all received frames and asks only for the missing frame.
CO3.exam_answer: The sender must retransmit the lost frame along with all subsequent frames.

CO3.exam_question: A company is using CSMA/CD (Ethernet) for its network. If the minimum frame size is 64 bytes and the propagation delay is 500 nanoseconds, what is the maximum cable length allowed before collisions become undetectable? (CO3)

Consider a network with 6 routers using Dijkstra's algorithm. If the number of direct links between routers increases from 10 to 15, how does this affect the worst-case time complexity of the algorithm? (CO3)
In a datagram network, each packet contains:(CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: The source and destination address in every packet
CO3.exam_ch2: Only the destination addresses in the first packet
CO3.exam_ch3: The source address only once per session
CO3.exam_ch4: No address, as it relies on virtual circuit switching
CO3.exam_answer: The source and destination address in every packet

CO3.exam_question: In a multipath routing scenario, if the shortest path fails, which routing algorithm ensures that the second shortest path is used immediately without recalculating the entire routing table? (CO3)
If a company has an IP range of 10.0.0.0/16 and needs at least 500 subnets, what subnet mask should be used? (CO3)
If a network with a class A IP address is divided into subnets using a /24 subnet mask, how many subnets can be created? (CO3)
A Selective Repeat ARQ system has a window size of 4. If the packet loss probability is 0.2, what is the expected number of transmissions per packet? (CO3)
In BGP (Border Gateway Protocol), what is the main purpose of the AS-PATH attribute?(CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: Determines the shortest path within an AS
CO3.exam_ch2: Avoids routing loops by listing the Assess traversed
CO3.exam_answer: Avoids routing loops by listing the Assess traversed

CO3.exam_question: In a network using OSPF, how is the cost of a route determined? (CO3)
CO3.exam_ch1: By the number of hops in the route
CO3.exam_ch2: By the link bandwidth, with lower cost given to higher bandwidth links
CO3.exam_ch3: By the delay of the path
CO3.exam_ch4: By the number of devices on the path
CO3.exam_answer: By the link bandwidth, with lower cost given to higher bandwidth links

CO3.exam_question: In a token ring network the transmission speed is 10^7 bps and the propagation speed is 200 metres/micro second. The 1-bit delay in this network is equivalent to:(CO3)
If an IP packet of size 2000 bytes is transmitted across a network with a 1500byte MTU, how many fragments will the packet be divided into? (CO3)

CO4.exam_question: Two computers C1 and C2 are configured as follows. C1 has IP address 203.197.2.53 and netmask 255.255.128.0. C2 has IP address 203.197.75.201 and netmask 255.255.192.0. which one of the following statements is true?(CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: C1 and C2 both assume they are on the same network
CO4.exam_ch2: C2 assumes C1 is on same network, but C1 assumes C2 is on a different network
CO4.exam_ch3: C1 assumes C2 is on same network, but C2 assumes C1 is on a different network
CO4.exam_ch4: C1 and C2 both assume they are on different networks
CO4.exam_answer: C1 assumes C2 is on same network, but C2 assumes C1 is on a different network

CO4.exam_question: In TCP, why does the three-way handshake mechanism include an acknowledgment for the initial SYN request?(CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: To ensure that the destination is available for communication.
CO4.exam_ch2: To prevent duplicate packets from being transmitted.
CO4.exam_ch3: To establish congestion control at the start of communication.
CO4.exam_ch4: To detect malicious attacks from unauthorized users.
CO4.exam_answer: To ensure that the destination is available for communication.

CO4.exam_question: Why does TCP flow control sometimes lead to unexpected bottlenecks in data transfer, even though it is designed to prevent buffer overflow at the receiver? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: TCP flow control can cause the sender to wait too long before sending data, creating an artificial bottleneck
CO4.exam_ch2: The receiver's advertised window size may become too large, causing network devices to drop packets to limit flow
CO4.exam_ch3: Flow control is not adaptive enough to handle sudden increases in traffic, causing delays in sending acknowledgments
CO4.exam_ch4: TCP's sliding window approach can cause data to be transmitted out of order, creating bottlenecks at the receiver
CO4.exam_answer: TCP flow control can cause the sender to wait too long before sending data, creating an artificial bottleneck

CO4.exam_question: A network has a 5 Mbps link with a roundtrip time (RTT) of 100 ms. What is the throughput of the TCP connection if the TCP window size is 10 KB? (CO4)
If a TCP connection has an RTT of 100 ms and a window size of 64 KB, what is the theoretical maximum throughput on a 1 Gbps link? (CO4)
TCP Congestion Window Growth A server's TCP congestion window starts at 1 MSS and grows exponentially until it reaches 64 KB. If MSS = 1460 bytes, how many RTTs are needed? (CO4)

Given the following dump of a UDP header in hexadecimal format: 1F90 0050 0032 0000 Answer the following questions: 1. What is the source port number? 2. What is the destination port number? 3. What is the length of the UDP header? 4. What is the checksum value? (CO4)
A 512-bit data packet is transmitted using Stop-and-Wait ARQ over a 10 Mbps link. The propagation delay is 5 ms. What is the total transmission time, including the acknowledgment delay? (CO4)

A company experiences high packet loss when multiple employees start video conferencing at the same time. The network administrator wants to improve TCP performance without upgrading bandwidth. Which congestion control mechanism would help? (CO4)

Suppose that the stop-and-wait protocol is used on a link with a bit rate of 64 kilobits per second and 20 milliseconds propagation delay. Assume that the transmission time for the acknowledgment and the processing time at nodes are negligible. Then the minimum frame size in bytes to achieve a link utilization of at least 50% is _________.(CO4)
Which of the following scenarios will cause a TCP connection to experience congestion? (CO4)
Which of the following statements is TRUE about CSMA/CD ?(CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: IEEE 802.11 wireless LAN runs CSMA/CD protocol
CO4.exam_ch2: Ethernet is not based on CSMA/CD protocol
CO4.exam_ch3: CSMA/CD is not suitable for a high propagation delay network like satellite network
CO4.exam_ch4: There is no contention in a CSMA/CD network
CO4.exam_answer: CSMA/CD is not suitable for a high propagation delay network like satellite network

CO4.exam_question: A 10 Mbps link has a propagation delay of 2 ms and a processing delay of 1 ms. A 10 KB (kilobyte) packet is transmitted. What is the total delay experienced by the packet? (CO4)
If two applications are communicating over a network, and the Session Layer of one device fails to synchronize properly, which of the following is most likely to happen? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: Data transfer will continue without any interruptions, but with degraded performance
CO4.exam_ch2: The application on the device will not be able to properly establish a session, leading to communication failure
CO4.exam_ch3: The receiver will receive data in an incorrect order, and the Session Layer will handle the reordering
CO4.exam_ch4: The session will automatically be re-established using alternative protocols, bypassing the Session Layer failure
CO4.exam_answer: The application on the device will not be able to properly establish a session, leading to communication failure

CO4.exam_question: A client initiates a TCP connection with a server using a three-way handshake. The initial sequence number (ISN) chosen by the client is 1000, and the server's ISN is 5000. What will be the acknowledgment number in the second and third handshake messages? (CO4)
A network packet of 1500 bytes is transmitted with a 32-bit CRC. If the CRC divisor is 1101, what is the remainder when the data is divided by the divisor? (CO4)

In an IPv4 datagram, the M bit is 0, the value of HLEN is 10, the value of total length is 400 and the fragment offset value is 300. The position of the datagram, the sequence numbers of the first and the last bytes of the payload, respectively are (CO4)
Why might multiplexing not always be more efficient than using dedicated channels for each communication stream? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: Multiplexing introduces overhead in both combining and separating signals, while dedicated channels provide direct communication with minimal overhead
CO4.exam_ch2: When using multiplexing, a single failure in the shared communication channel can disrupt all multiplexed streams, while dedicated channels are isolated from each other
CO4.exam_ch3: In cases of low traffic, multiplexing can waste resources by combining multiple streams unnecessarily, whereas dedicated channels can be more resource-efficient when demand is low

CO4.exam_question: A TCP connection starts with an initial sequence number of 1000. If the first segment contains 500 bytes, what will be the sequence number of the next segment? (CO4)
A server communicates with a client over TCP, and the server has a limited buffer size. What would happen if the client sends data faster than the server's buffer can handle? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: The server will send an ACK and continue receiving data
CO4.exam_ch2: The server will send a flow control message to the client to slow down transmission
CO4.exam_ch3: The server will close the connection
CO4.exam_ch4: The client will automatically reduce the sending speed
CO4.exam_answer: The server will send a flow control message to the client to slow down transmission

CO4.exam_question: In a TCP connection, which of the following events triggers the initiation of the congestion avoidance phase? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: When the TCP window size exceeds the slowstart threshold
CO4.exam_ch2: When the maximum segment size (MSS) is reached
CO4.exam_answer: When the TCP window size exceeds the slowstart threshold

CO4.exam_question: Every host in an IPv4 network has a 1-second resolution real-time clock with battery backup. Each host needs to generate up to 1000 unique identifiers per second. Assume that each host has a globally unique IPv4 address. Design a 50-bit globally unique ID for this purpose. After what period (in seconds) will the identifiers generated by a host wrap around?(CO4)
A system transmits 512-bit data blocks and appends a 16-bit CRC for error detection. If the data transmission rate is 100 Mbps, how long does it take to transmit one data block? (CO4)

Consider a LAN with four nodes S1, S2, S3 and S4. Time is divided into fixed-size slots, and a node can begin its transmission only at the beginning of a slot. A collision is said to have occurred if more than one node transmit in the same slot. The probabilities of generation of a frame in a time slot by S1, S2, S3 and S4 are 0.1, 0.2, 0.3 and 0.4, respectively. The probability of sending a frame in the first slot without any collision by any of these four stations is _________ (CO4)
A TCP connection has an RTT of 196 ms. If the window size is 49 KB and the link bandwidth is 2 Mbps, what is the throughput? (CO4)
How does the Session Layer contribute to maintaining the integrity of data flow between two devices when one device unexpectedly disconnects during a communication session? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: By retransmitting all lost data from the last checkpoint
CO4.exam_ch2: By ensuring that the session remains open for indefinite retries until successful re-establishment
CO4.exam_ch3: By re-synchronizing the session from the last saved checkpoint, ensuring data consistency
CO4.exam_ch4: By transferring all unacknowledged data to a buffer on the receiver side, allowing the session to resume later.
CO4.exam_answer: By re-synchronizing the session from the last saved checkpoint, ensuring data consistency

CO4.exam_question: The routing table of a router is shown below: Destination Sub net mask Interface 128.75.43.0 255.255.255.0 Eth0 128.75.43.0 255.255.255.128 Eth1 192.12.17.5 255.255.255.255 Eth3 default Eth2 On which interfaces will the router forward packets addressed to destinations 128.75.43.16 and 192.12.17.10 respectively?(CO4)
Why might longer domain names increase the overall DNS resolution time, even though they provide more detailed identification of resources? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: Longer domain names result in more complex DNS records, requiring additional processing time and storage space
CO4.exam_ch2: DNS resolution systems may have limited buffer sizes for long domain names, leading to inefficiencies and delays in resolving them
CO4.exam_ch3: The longer the domain name, the more DNS servers may need to be queried, increasing the overall resolution time

CO4.exam_question: A system implements the Leaky Bucket algorithm for traffic shaping. The system receives bursty traffic at varying rates but has a fixed output rate of 10 Mbps. If the incoming rate remains at 15 Mbps for 5 seconds, what is the minimum bucket size required to avoid packet loss?(CO4)

A 6000-byte packet (including a 20-byte header) needs to be transmitted over a network with an MTU of 1500 bytes. How many fragments are created, and what is the offset value of the last fragment? (CO4)
Why might the UDP checksum sometimes fail to detect certain errors, even though it is designed to ensure data integrity? (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: The UDP checksum only covers the header, not the data, allowing some errors in the payload to go undetected.
CO4.exam_ch2: Some systems may disable the UDP checksum for performance reasons, allowing errors to pass unnoticed
CO4.exam_ch3: The checksum algorithm used by UDP is not strong enough to detect certain types of corruption, like bit-level errors
CO4.exam_ch4: The UDP checksum is optional in some network configurations, leading to errors being ignored.
CO4.exam_answer: Some systems may disable the UDP checksum for performance reasons, allowing errors to pass unnoticed

CO4.exam_question: A TCP connection has an initial sequence number of 4000. The first data segment sent by the sender contains 1000 bytes of data. What is the sequence number of the first byte of the next data segment? (CO4)
A data block of 8 bits (10101100) is encoded using even parity Hamming Code. What will be the transmitted codeword? (CO4)
In a multicast transmission, which protocol is typically used for group communication over the internet?(CO4)
Why can the lack of flow control in UDP sometimes lead to unexpected issues in data transmission, despite UDP's faster nature?  (CO4)
CO4.exam_ch1: Without flow control, UDP may overwhelm the receiver with too many packets, leading to buffer overflow and data loss
CO4.exam_ch2: UDP does not have a mechanism for managing retransmissions, leading to prolonged periods of data loss
CO4.exam_ch3: Flow control in UDP is too aggressive, causing too many packets to be dropped
CO4.exam_ch4: UDP's lack of flow control causes the sender to ignore the receiver's processing speed, which results in excessive delays
CO4.exam_answer: Without flow control, UDP may overwhelm the receiver with too many packets, leading to buffer overflow and data loss

CO4.exam_question: A file is transferred from node A to node B over a TCP connection. If the TCP congestion window is 64 KB and the roundtrip time is 80 ms, what is the maximum throughput that can be achieved? (CO4)

CO5.exam_question: In class C , if subnet mask is 255.255.255.224, then calculates number of subnet? (CO5)

Consider a TCP connection in a state where there are no outstanding ACKs. The sender sends two segments back to back. The sequence numbers of the first and second segments are 230 and 290 respectively. The first segment was lost, but the second segment was received correctly by the receiver. Let X be the amount of data carried in the first segment (in bytes), and Y be the ACK number sent by the receiver. The values of X and Y (in that order) are (CO5)

You are configuring a Firewall to filter incoming traffic. Which type of packet filtering method should be used if you want to check the state of connections and block packets that do not belong to an established connection? (CO5)
In a VPN setup using IPSec, which protocol is responsible for ensuring data confidentiality by encrypting the payload? (CO5)
In a largescale cloud network with multiple virtual machines, which approach is most effective for achieving load balancing? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: Use roundrobin DNS for distributing client requests
CO5.exam_ch2: Use a centralized load balancer to distribute traffic based on server health and load
CO5.exam_ch3: Use multiple DNS servers to distribute traffic based on geographical location
CO5.exam_ch4: Use static IP addressing for all virtual machines
CO5.exam_answer: Use a centralized load balancer to distribute traffic based on server health and load

CO5.exam_question: A web server receives an HTTP request for a file that is found on the server. What HTTP status code should the server send in response? (CO5)
How does the Application Layer handle the complexity of multiple clients accessing the same server in a web application? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: By providing a mechanism to queue all incoming requests and process them in sequence
CO5.exam_ch2: By assigning each client a unique session ID, which is used to track and maintain state across multiple interactions
CO5.exam_ch3: By allowing multiple clients to share the same session, using a shared session ID for all users
CO5.exam_ch4: By establishing separate channels for each client, allowing them to interact simultaneously without interference
CO5.exam_answer: By assigning each client a unique session ID, which is used to track and maintain state across multiple interactions

CO5.exam_question: A web client is downloading a file using FTP in passive mode. Which of the following conditions may cause the download to fail?(CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: The FTP server does not allow incoming connections
CO5.exam_ch2: The client's firewall blocks outbound high-numbered ports
CO5.exam_ch3: The FTP client attempts authentication via anonymous login
CO5.exam_ch4: The FTP server is running on port 21 instead of port 22
CO5.exam_answer: The client's firewall blocks outbound high-numbered ports

CO5.exam_question: Which protocol is commonly used to secure communications between a web browser and a web server? (CO5)

If an application relies on multiple Application Layer protocols for its functionality, such as HTTP for web browsing and SMTP for email, how might an issue with one protocol affect the overall operation of the application? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: The application would fail entirely as both protocols are required to be operational at the same time
CO5.exam_ch2: The failure of one protocol (e.g., HTTP) would have no impact on the operation of the other protocol (e.g., SMTP)
CO5.exam_ch3: The application would continue functioning for a while but may eventually experience inconsistencies in communication across protocols
CO5.exam_ch4: The failure of one protocol could result in partial application functionality, with the other protocol being used as a fallback method
CO5.exam_answer: The application would continue functioning for a while but may eventually experience inconsistencies in communication across protocols

CO5.exam_question: A radio transmission system uses a 5-bit Hamming Code for error detection. If the codeword received is 1001101, what is the corrected codeword? (CO5)
In a VoIP call, the audio is typically sampled at 8 kHz. If each sample is represented by 16 bits, what is the bit rate of the audio stream? (CO5)
A subnet has been assigned a subnet mask of 255.255.255.192. What is the maximum number of hosts that can belong to this subnet? (CO5)
During the SSL/TLS handshake between a client and a server, which of the following steps is NOT part of the process? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch3: Establishing the server's public-private key pair
CO5.exam_ch4: Client sends a session ID to the server
CO5.exam_answer: Establishing the server's public-private key pair

CO5.exam_question: Which of the following is the primary purpose of using P2P (Peer-to-Peer) architecture in file sharing applications? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: To improve scalability by distributing load among peers
CO5.exam_ch2: To centralize the management of file availability
CO5.exam_ch3: To reduce the number of peers that can access the file
CO5.exam_ch4: To restrict peer communication to the central server
CO5.exam_answer: To improve scalability by distributing load among peers

CO5.exam_question: A link has a transmission speed of 10^6 bits/sec. It uses data packets of size 1000 bytes each. Assume that the acknowledgment has negligible transmission delay, and that its propagation delay is the same as the data propagation delay. Also assume that the processing delays at nodes are negligible. The efficiency of the stop-and-wait protocol in this setup is exactly 25%. The value of the one-way propagation delay (in milliseconds) is (CO5)
If two devices are communicating over a network, and one device uses a different data encoding format for video than the other, how does the Presentation Layer handle this discrepancy? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: The Presentation Layer will automatically convert the data into a common format, ensuring compatibility between the two devices
CO5.exam_ch2: The Presentation Layer will ignore the encoding differences and directly pass the data to the Application Layer
CO5.exam_ch3: The Presentation Layer will trigger the devices to use a common protocol that supports both formats, like TLS
CO5.exam_ch4: The Presentation Layer will discard the incompatible data, causing the communication to fail
CO5.exam_answer: The Presentation Layer will automatically convert the data into a common format, ensuring compatibility between the two devices

CO5.exam_question: Consider a P2P file-sharing network. If a file is divided into 10 equal-sized chunks, and each peer downloads only one chunk from another peer, what is the minimum number of peers required to download the entire file? (CO5)

A DNS resolver receives a query for a domain name. The resolver performs the following steps: 1. Queries the root DNS server 2. Queries the TLD (Top-Level Domain) server 3. Queries the authoritative DNS server If each query-response pair takes 40 ms and there are 3 steps in the resolution process, what is the total time taken for the DNS resolution? (CO5)

A DNS query is sent from a client to a DNS server. If the round-trip time (RTT) between the client and the DNS server is 50 ms, and the DNS server processes the query in 30 ms, what is the total time taken to resolve the query from the client's perspective? (CO5)
Why might an HTTP request sometimes result in a delayed response, despite the server being fully operational? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: HTTP responses can be delayed due to server-side processing, such as database queries or complex business logic that needs to be executed before responding
CO5.exam_ch2: Network congestion or routing issues between the client and server may slow down the delivery of the HTTP response
CO5.exam_ch3: The server may be under heavy load, resulting in queued requests and delayed response times

CO5.exam_question: In the Application Layer, how would the use of different encoding schemes (like ASCII vs. UTF-8) impact interoperability between two systems communicating over a network? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: Systems using different encoding schemes would not be able to interpret the data correctly, leading to communication failure
CO5.exam_ch2: Different encoding schemes allow systems to communicate more efficiently by providing additional data compression
CO5.exam_ch3: Systems would automatically convert the encoding schemes to a common standard, allowing seamless communication
CO5.exam_ch4: Encoding differences would have no effect on the communication process as long as the same Application Layer protocol is used
CO5.exam_answer: Systems using different encoding schemes would not be able to interpret the data correctly, leading to communication failure

CO5.exam_question: A company is facing phishing attacks where employees are tricked into visiting fake websites. What is the best security solution? (CO5)
In the DNS hierarchy, which of the following scenarios is least likely to cause resolution failure when a user queries a website? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: If the root DNS server is down
CO5.exam_ch2: If the local DNS cache is outdated
CO5.exam_ch3: If the TLD server does not respond
CO5.exam_ch4: If the authoritative server for the domain is unreachable
CO5.exam_answer: If the local DNS cache is outdated

CO5.exam_question: A network administrator notices frequent collisions in a network using a hub. What is the best way to reduce collisions while maintaining network connectivity? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: Replace the hub with a switch
CO5.exam_answer: Replace the hub with a switch

CO5.exam_question: Two popular routing algorithms are Distance Vector(DV) and Link State (LS) routing. Which of the following are true? (S1) Count to infinity is a problem only with DV and not LS routing (S2) In LS, the shortest path algorithm is run only at one node (S3) In DV, the shortest path algorithm is run only at one node (S4) DV requires lesser number of network messages than LS (CO5)
Which of the following is true about FTP (File Transfer Protocol)? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: FTP uses a single TCP connection for both control and data transfer
CO5.exam_ch2: FTP operates only in passive mode
CO5.exam_ch3: FTP provides error detection and correction mechanisms
CO5.exam_ch4: FTP uses multiple TCP connections for control and data transfer
CO5.exam_answer: FTP uses multiple TCP connections for control and data transfer

CO5.exam_question: Host A sends a UDP datagram containing 8880 bytes of user data to host B over an Ethernet LAN. Ethernet frames may carry data up to 1500 bytes (i.e. MTU = 1500 bytes). Size of UDP header is 8 bytes and size of IP header is 20 bytes. There is no option field in IP header. How may total number of IP fragments will be transmitted and what will be the contents of offset field in the last fragment?

A DNS server receives a query for the IP address of "www.google.com." The DNS server has this information cached. If the round-trip time (RTT) between the client and the DNS server is 20 ms, how long will it take to respond to the query? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch4: Depends on the size of the cache

CO5.exam_question: In a situation where two devices are exchanging data, and one of the devices sends an encrypted message, how does the Presentation Layer facilitate the decryption process? (CO5)
CO5.exam_ch1: The Presentation Layer directly decrypts the message using the appropriate algorithm before passing it to the Application Layer
CO5.exam_ch2: The Presentation Layer relies on the Transport Layer to decrypt the data before passing it to the Application Layer
CO5.exam_ch3: The Application Layer is responsible for decrypting the message, with no involvement from the Presentation Layer
CO5.exam_ch4: The Presentation Layer ignores the encryption and forwards the encrypted data to the Application Layer for processing
CO5.exam_answer: The Presentation Layer directly decrypts the message using the appropriate algorithm before passing it to the Application Layer

CO5.exam_question: An SMTP server queues outgoing emails and processes 100 emails per minute. If each email has an average size of 50 KB and the network bandwidth is 5 Mbps, what is the minimum time required to clear a backlog of 10,000 emails? (CO5)

A web page contains 5 images, each of size 100 KB. Assuming an HTTP 1.1 connection with persistent connections, what is the minimum number of TCP connections required to download all the images? (CO5)

Which of the following statements are TRUE? (S1) TCP handles both congestion and flow control (S2) UDP handles congestion but not flow control (S3) Fast retransmit deals with congestion but not flow control (S4) Slow start mechanism deals with both congestion and flow control(CO5)
If a message is *hashed* using SHA-256, how many bits will the hash output be?  (CO5)

A DNS server has a hierarchical domain structure where each node in the hierarchy has a maximum of 256 child nodes. If the depth of the hierarchy is 4, what is the maximum number of domain names that can be represented in this structure? (CO5)
In TCP, a unique sequence number is assigned to each (CO5)
